pageContext.claim: “I signed and they figured the show would be a total failure, so they only signed me for one season. You know, it was going to, go on, and then the show does started at 10 went to eight, went to seven, went to five, went to four, went to two, it went to one. I had the number one show in all of television. It was a phenomenal, phenomenal.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump’s reality television show, "The Apprentice," was a hit at first, but it was never number one. It debuted with a big splash in the 2003-2004 season, and immediately ranked seventh among primetime shows, averaging almost 21 million viewers a week. But that was the show’s only year in the top 10. After its second season, neither The Apprentice nor its successor, The Celebrity Apprentice, cracked the top 20 again. Four years into its run, roughly half as many people watched as had when the show debuted.
